definition: to show off one's ability/to boast one's merits
to show off/to flaunt/to carry out or succeed in a scheme/to indulge/to give free rein to
surname Neng
can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy

sentences.english: Not so tough now, are you?
Billy, don't be a hero, come back and make me your wife.
sentences.chinese: 比利，别逞能，回来让我做你的妻子。

sentences.english: Refers to in one way or a little?
sentences.chinese: 指在某一方面略有知识就逞能的人。

sentences.english: Billy, don't be a hero, come back to me.
sentences.chinese: 比利，别逞能，回到我身边来。

sentences.english: Her five-year-old daughter likes to act up before scores of visitors.
sentences.chinese: 她那五岁的小女儿喜欢在很多的客人面前逞能。

sentences.english: Kids showing off on the diving board.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在跳水板上逞能。

sentences.english: Yet Dennis cockily said that he slept like a baby during all that volatility.
sentences.chinese: 然而丹尼斯逞能地说他在波动期间睡得像小孩一样。

sentences.english: Every cock crows on his own dunghill.
sentences.chinese: 公鸡总在自己的粪堆上逞能。

sentences.english: I didn't try to tell her the truth, sms.
sentences.chinese: 我没逞能，短信悉数告诉她实情。

sentences.english: The boy who showed off his strength was Bartholomew! He was fond of showing himself.
sentences.chinese: 这个逞能的叫巴塞洛缪，特别喜欢表现自己。

sentences.english: Mulan was very sad, blame her father again in bravado.
sentences.chinese: 木兰非常伤心，她责怪父亲又在逞能。

definition: to show off/to try to be brave
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
to show off/to flaunt/to carry out or succeed in a scheme/to indulge/to give free rein to
to act arbitrarily regardless of the rules/to mess with sth/to make a hash of things/to cause trouble
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5

definition: to make a fool of oneself
to lose face
to make an exhibition of oneself/to be a disgrace
confused/mixed up/muddled up/befuddled
shameful/scandalous/to be humiliated/to make a fool of sb or oneself/to make sb lose face
to bring trouble on oneself
to be foolish/to play dumb/to gaze absentmindedly
lit. not knowing what's important (idiom); no appreciation of the gravity of things/naive/doesn't know who's who/no sense of priorities
to let emotions affect one's decisions
to overestimate one's capabilities (idiom)
to suffer/to suffer for one's actions/to pay dearly/to burn one's fingers
